none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on August 04, 2010 Description from Terminal Escape:
There's probably not really that much still to be said about Southern California's MINDROT. Listening to these songs now, there is no doubt that they are metal, but I first heard of them as a punk band, and I imagine that is how they are still associated by most people. This tape came from Devon's collection (there will likely be more gems from his stash going up in the coming months), and along with the tape came the tale of Devon going to San Jose with Rick Ta Life (careful, the link is loud) to check out MINDROT with PLUTOCRACY and EXHUMED - I can only imagine that trip was....a trip. Mid tempo, booming, proto-anarcho-death-metal from pre-DYSTOPIA members. MINDROT 1990 DEMO
//2.bp.blogspot.com/_UWPI3C1CSoU/TFinSBaH3yI/AAAAAAAABJg/HYeJJeOfZuE/s1600/mindrot+cover.jpg http://ricktalife.ytmnd.com/ //4.bp.blogspot.com/_UWPI3C1CSoU/TFiqwtFHsWI/AAAAAAAABJo/x3IUx6RlxKk/s1600/mindrot+inside.jpg

seo.title: Mindrot - Mindrot demo 1990 - Terminal Escape
